alert.note: Alert for Northampton (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 7:27PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Northampton, Greensville, southwestern Southampton, Sussex, southeastern Dinwiddie and southern Brunswick Counties and the City of Emporia through 815 PM EDT... At 726 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Dinwiddie to Radium to near Brodnax. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Purdy and Radium around 730 PM EDT. Emporia, Jarratt and Carson around 735 PM EDT. Stony Creek and Green Plain around 745 PM EDT. Claresville around 750 PM EDT. Sussex and Barley around 755 PM EDT. Homeville around 800 PM EDT. Roanoke Rapids and Gaston around 810 PM EDT. Garysburg, Dahlia and Seaboard around 815 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Adams Grove, Grizzard, Gum Forks, Bufford Crossroads, Lanes Corner, Booker, Bowens Corner, Yale, Pleasant Shade and Henrico. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. If you are on or near Lake Gaston, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike more than 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for northeastern North Carolina...and south central and southeastern Virginia.
